comments:
When trying to reproduce bug 136830 I noticed some strange behaviour. I had to click twice on "Workbench" to make the initial screen disappear and than the different views (Package, Editor, Problems etc.) would not be visible. After a close of eclipse and reopen, they would be visible and also show the created projects.

So I wanted to try to close eclipse immediatly after the start in the fresh directory and upon closing I got an error dialog. Here how I can reproduce this:

$ cd  /tmp; rm -rf /tmp/freshDirectory
$ mkdir /tmp/freshDirectory
$ cd  /tmp/freshDirectory
$ HOME=/tmp/freshDirectory /usr/local/java/eclipse/eclipse -consoleLog -data /tmp/freshDirectory

Select "Exit" from the "File" Menu. The following exception occurs:

!SESSION 2006-04-18 21:05:16.552 -----------------------------------------------
eclipse.buildId=I20060413-1718
java.version=1.5.0_06
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=linux, ARCH=x86, WS=gtk, NL=en_GB

and a dialog box appears telling me "An error has occurred. See error log for more Details. Do you want to exit?"

I click on "Yes". Then I start eclipse again:

$ HOME=/tmp/freshDirectory /usr/local/java/eclipse/eclipse -consoleLog -data /tmp/freshDirectory

The Java perspective appears. File->Exit works without problems.

Yet if I restart this procedure, i.e. delete /tmp/freshDirectory and recreate it and then start eclipse, the very same error happens again.

Dejan fixed this one today.

Note: This only happens with the forms-based intro, which is only used when it cannot find a properly configured browser. This means you're not getting the full welcome experience - you're getting the "backup" that is not as nice.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 136750 ***
